required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Dance Intervention for Children With Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of a Therapeutic Dance Intervention for Children With Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: Children with cerebral palsy (CP) have motor impairments that make it challenging for them to participate in standard physical activity (PA) programs. There is a need to evaluate adapted PA programs for this population. Dance can promote coordination, posture, muscle strength, motor learning, and executive functioning. This pilot study evaluated the feasibility and the effects of a new therapeutic ballet intervention specifically designed for children with CP on physiological and executive functions outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: 8 children with CP (9-14y/o; 75% female) participated in a six-week therapeutic ballet program. Participants had body composition (DXA), muscle strength (hand-grip dynamometer), habitual physical activity, gait and selective motor control functions, and executive function tasks before and after the intervention. Follow-up assessments of habitual physical activity, gait and executive functions were completed four to five week post-intervention.

primary_outcome.description: Assessment before an immediately after six-week therapeutic ballet program and 4-5 weeks post intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Executive Functions measured by Hearts and Flowers Flanker Tasks
primary_outcome.description: Measures attention and working memory before an immediately after six-week therapeutic ballet program and 4-5 weeks post intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Executive Functions measured by Stroop Colored Word Test
primary_outcome.description: Measures inhibitory control before an immediately after six-week therapeutic ballet program and 4-5 weeks post intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Executive Functions measured by BRIEF (Parent Questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Composition Dual X-ray Absorptiometry, DXA scan before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program.
Body Composition Dual X-ray Absorptiometry, DXA scan before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program.
Body Composition Dual X-ray Absorptiometry, DXA scan before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program.

secondary_outcome.description: Handgrip (evaluated maximum isometric strength (Kg) before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program.
Includes hemoglobin measures for anemia and inflammation factors
CVD risk factors (lipid screen ) before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program
Physical activity was measured using ActiGraph accelerometers before and immediately after six-week therapeutic ballet program and 4-5 weeks post intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Social and Emotional Functioning measured by Self-Efficacy Survey (Child)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures individual perceptions of one's capacity to manage one's functioning and control over events before and after six-week therapeutic ballet program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Social and Emotional Functioning measured by Self-Perception Profile for Children
secondary_outcome.description: Measures Scholastic Competence, Athletic Competence, Social Competence, Physical Appearance, and Behavioral Conduct.

secondary_outcome.measure: Social and Emotional Functioning measured by Positive Affect Survey.
secondary_outcome.description: Measures feelings of pleasurable engagement with the environment (happiness, joy, excitement, engagement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Social and Emotional Functioning measured by Perceived Stress Self-Report Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Asks participants to rate how they have felt over the last month

secondary_outcome.measure: Social and Emotional Functioning measured by Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
secondary_outcome.description: SDQ is a brief questionnaire that assesses children's emotional problems

arm_group.description: Children with CP (9-15 years old) participated in a therapeutic dance program to improve physical, physiological and cognitive outcomes.

intervention.description: Participants attended therapeutic ballet sessions three times per week for six weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cerebral palsy spastic diplegia and/or hemiplegia
- Absence of health problems that would preclude participation in exercise
- Male or female age 9 - 15 years inclusive at the time of consent
- Minimum level of intellectual functioning (e.g., as determined by an IQ score of 80 or above or other education placement and testing indicating sufficient understanding)
- Ability to complete study measures at the assessment
- Ability to participate in dance classes conducted in English
- Interest in learning ballet
- Intact vision
- Intact hearing
- Able to ambulate independently in the community with or without a device
- Intact proprioception in lower extremities
- Able to complete assessment measures and consents in English
- Referral from the child's pediatrician or other physician indicating that the child is physically able to participate in an exercise intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with a current diagnosis of severe Major Depressive Disorder
- Generalized Anxiety Disorder
- Epilepsy
- Autism
- Other major medical conditions that prohibit full participation and children with severe developmental disorders (e.g., mental retardation, severe autism) or with physical impairments that prohibit full participation were excluded from the study.
